meanings.definition: To place or lay (one thing) over another.
meanings.sent1: She is superposing the blue blanket on top of the red one.
meanings.sent2: The artist is superposing different colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent3: The chef superposed the cheese on the pizza in the shape of a smiley face.
meanings.sent4: The clouds superposed the sun, creating a stunning sunset.
meanings.sent5: The magician superposed two cards to perform a trick.

meanings.sent1: He is superposing extra toppings on his ice cream sundae.
meanings.sent2: The student is superposing more details to his essay to make it longer.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel superposed more acorns to its already full stash.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter superposed a joyful atmosphere to the room.
meanings.sent5: The gardener superposed fertilizer to help the plants grow.
